description: This course introduces students to the history and art of ancient Greece.  It covers more
than 2000 years of Greek civilization, from the Bronze Age through the archaic,
classical, and Hellenistic periods.  The itinerary takes students all over
Greece, with extended stays in Athens and Attica, Crete, the Peloponnese, and Thessaloniki. When
visiting museums and archaeological sites, students have the opportunity to experience modern
Greek culture as well.  Offered during January Term in alternate years.  Apply through Smith
Center for Global Engagement.  Also counts toward ancient
